parse.title: Thrower Troll

Thrower Troll
For the variant encountered in Daemonheim, see Thrower troll (Dungeoneering).
Not to be confused with troll ranger.

Thrower trolls are trolls that attack with ranged. They are relatively annoying monsters that throw rocks at passing adventurers, often attacking from the top of a cliff shouting "Urg!". They can hit very hard and are often found in packs that can quickly kill unprepared players. A Fremennik round shield can reduce their max hit (below about 160), but this method is seldom used because people prefer using other shields or activating Protect from Ranged/Deflect Ranged.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.
Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Key token1RareNot soldNot alchemisable

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 12 February 2024 (Update):
    • Rebalanced several low level monsters that were harder to kill than intended
  • update 7 August 2023 (Update):
    • Thrower trolls now do much more damage but also give more experience.
  • update 9 August 2004 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • For a while after the Evolution of Combat, Thrower trolls near the God Wars Dungeon entrance were unaggressive. This was later fixed.
  • Before the Instanced God Wars update on 30 April 2013, when a Thrower Troll attacked a player, the player was not in the combat stance. It was later fixed with the aforementioned update.
